item.title: The Formula to Calculate the Pressure of a Fluid Based on Depth
item.description: Formulas The pressure of a fluid at a vertical distance $h$ below the surface, or simply, the fluid pressure at a depth of $h$, $P_{h}$, is as follows. $$ P_{h}=P_{0}+\rho g h $$ Here, $P_{0}$ is the atmospheric pressure, $\rho$ is the density of the object, and $g$ is the gravitational acceleration. item.title: Fluid Pressure
item.description: Definition A pressure is the force acting per unit area by a fluid. Let’s denote $F$ as the force, $A$ as the area upon which the force acts, and $P$ as the pressure.
